instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON â€“ CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .

threads.title: 3115 -b no cpu v core ,!!!! i did a compare excelsheet pls chk attach file
threads.message:
finally turbo here ;).. <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board, no cpu v-core.. fun running high speed, i have a compare excel sheet for <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> chip in put , pls chk... attach file 

it had water damage, i had to did connect t29 circuit.   

cant attach file it says invalid xlx!!

threads.title: 3115 -b no cpu v core ,!!!! i did a compare excelsheet pls chk attach file
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R7403</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> measure what? Is the trace from <RESISTOR>R7403</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> to <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> intact? It can look intact but not have continuity as part of it goes under the chip. Check carefully!

threads.title: 3115 -b no cpu v core ,!!!! i did a compare excelsheet pls chk attach file
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R7403</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> is 182 and 151,  line is intact

threads.title: 3115 -b no cpu v core ,!!!! i did a compare excelsheet pls chk attach file
threads.message: can you find out anything from that value chart for all pin

threads.title: 3115 -b no cpu v core ,!!!! i did a compare excelsheet pls chk attach file
threads.message: louis just found out L7630 = 1.05v, but  L7510 , l7520 and L7550 no voltage

threads.title: 3115 -b no cpu v core ,!!!! i did a compare excelsheet pls chk attach file
threads.message: What area was water damaged? Corrosion under/around PCH will also cause no Vcore. <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> needs to be enabled through SMBUS, so PCH and CPU VCCIO need to be running.

threads.title: 3115 -b no cpu v core ,!!!! i did a compare excelsheet pls chk attach file
threads.message:
If <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> & <RESISTOR>R7403</RESISTOR> are good it will be corrosion under <CHIP>U1800</CHIP>. Some kester 951 and a gentle reflow of <CHIP>U1800</CHIP> - GENTLE, the PCH is a very easy to kill chip with heat, will do.

I go over it here. [URL="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pQHW_ZdBP3o&nohtml5=False"]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pQHW...&nohtml5=False[/URL] The video also includes the logic & intuition that one would follow to come to this conclusion, so you not only get the answer, but how you'd find the answer yourself next time!

It is very easy to kill the PCH. I see the balls melt for 5 seconds and I turn off the heater and turn on the fans to be on the safe side.

duke knows more about this circuit than I do, so follow his advice over mine. My guess would be on corrosion you can't see under <CHIP>U1800</CHIP>. Ultrasonic won't fix this, heat and flux.

threads.title: 3115 -b no cpu v core ,!!!! i did a compare excelsheet pls chk attach file
threads.message: thanks for quick reply , <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> might be bad too? even thou i replaced this from a good known board, i ordered some <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>, ill reflow pch after changing <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>... is this a good idea?

threads.title: 3115 -b no cpu v core ,!!!! i did a compare excelsheet pls chk attach file
threads.message: U 7400 usually only goes bad when one of the high side mosfets for the CPU vcore Buck converter shorts. Otherwise it is fine.
